title: [K-12] Problem-Based Collaborative Learning for Developing Scientific Inquiry and Language Reasoning Abilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science concepts (hypothesis formulation路variable control) and college-level language comprehension skills (grammar路vocabulary路reading路writing)
context.additional_context: A graduate-level language course conducting project-based assessments in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments. Focuses on improving learners' text analysis/expression skills and integrating scientific inquiry methods.

learning_goals: Learners analyze complex linguistic data (text/discourse) to generate scientific hypotheses and derive evidence-based conclusions.
Learners perform language evidence collection and evaluation processes through collaborative problem-solving with peers, enhancing critical thinking.
Learners observe real-world linguistic phenomena (conversations/texts), improve problem-definition and question-generation skills, and acquire inquiry-based reading techniques.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
